SEARCH
Package com.example.chicksevent

Class EventPosterUploadTest

java.lang.Object
com.example.chicksevent.EventPosterUploadTest
public class EventPosterUploadTest extends Object
Unit tests for US 02.04.01: As an organizer I want to upload an event poster to the event details page to provide visual information to entrants. These tests validate that:
  • Events can be created with poster information
  • Poster field is stored correctly in Firebase
  • Poster can be optional (null or empty)
  • Poster field is accessible via getter methods
  • Poster can be updated after event creation

      public void organizer_eventPoster_canBeBase64String()
      Test Case 11: Event poster can be base64 encoded string. As an organizer, the poster can be stored as a base64 encoded string (which is how it's stored in Firebase Image service).

      Test Case 14: Event poster field is optional in constructor. As an organizer, the poster parameter in the Event constructor is optional and can be null without causing errors.

      Test Case 15: Event poster can be long URL string. As an organizer, the poster URL can be a long string without causing issues.

      public void organizer_eventPoster_canBeDataUri()
      Test Case 16: Event poster can be data URI format. As an organizer, the poster can be stored in data URI format (data:image/jpeg;base64,...).

    • organizer_eventPoster_independentOfOtherFields

      public void organizer_eventPoster_independentOfOtherFields()
      Test Case 17: Event poster is independent of other event fields. As an organizer, changing the poster should not affect other event fields like name, description, or dates.

    • organizer_multipleEvents_canShareSamePoster

      public void organizer_multipleEvents_canShareSamePoster()
      Test Case 18: Multiple events can share the same poster URL. As an organizer, multiple events can use the same poster URL if desired.

      Exception

      Exception
